meaningMnemonic: You've learned that the kanji 絞 means <kanji>strangle</kanji>. 絞る, on the other hand, means <vocabulary>to wring out</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to squeeze</vocabulary> something like a towel, or <vocabulary>to narrow down</vocabulary> ideas.
readingMnemonic: Your friend wants <vocabulary>to wring out</vocabulary> a towel, but before she does so <reading>she bow</reading>s (しぼ) to the towel to show her respect for it.
